cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 335 mi S of Panama City Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north across the eastern Gulf, then turning northeast across the southeastern U.S. and accelerating off the Mid-Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle/Big Bend near Panama City FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch from Chassahowitzka to Anna Maria Island FL (incl. Tampa Bay) and from the Mississippi/Alabama border to the Mouth of the Pearl River, plus Fernandina Beach FL to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warning Alabama/Florida border to Suwannee River FL; Tropical-storm warning AL/FL border to Mississippi/Alabama border and Suwannee River FL to Chassahowitzka FL; Storm-surge warning Okaloosa/Walton County Line FL to Anclote River FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Panhandle and Big Bend, inland AL/GA, the Carolinas, and the Mid-Atlantic coast including Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with possible gusts to 35–40 mph as the storm’s remnants pass Friday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge expected in Chesapeake Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible Friday with locally higher amounts in bands.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and brief coastal flooding or high waves in Chesapeake Bay could disrupt port operations.
